[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 22]
Reasoning: **Evaluating strategy for cards**

I think we should use the item since just having it isn't helpful, and it sells for $1. However, keeping it for later is an option. Using it now could improve our score, especially since three of a kind is common. I believe our deck consists of 52 cards, but we have only 40 remaining.

Using it boosts our level, which increases chips from 30 to 50 and the multiplier from 3 to 5, which feels strong. So, I think first, I'll use Venus for a free level-up and then purchase the Buffoon pack.
**Deciding next action**

Each task requires a single action, so I need to pick what to do next. It seems like using a consumable to level up the three of a kind is the way to go. I'm wondering if it needs a target. Since we're on the planet, no targets are required. The command does mention positions, but I can just provide the consumable position. So, I’ll go ahead and choose to use the consumable now.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

**Analyzing chip and multiplier effects**

I’m trying to understand how Odd Todd adds chips and if the order matters for scoring. Chips are added first, then modifiers, and scoring happens from left to right. If Odd Todd comes before Ancient Joker, it adds chips before the multiplier kicks in. The global multiplier affects the total hand’s chips, but since chips and multipliers are separate, I think the order won’t ultimately change the final score if they're independent. However, some jokers can tie multipliers to chip values, which adds a bit of nuance.
**Finalizing actions with jokers**

I’m looking at how Ancient Joker multiplies the multiplier and Odd Todd adds chips. Since multiplying the multiplier is commutative, it won’t matter when I do it—my end result will be the same. Adding chips is also independent of the order. However, if Ancient Joker triggers a multiplier based on spade cards scored, that might affect things.
